title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 848.4 - Table I

State Regulations
TABLE I
CLASSIFICATIONS AND STANDARDS OF QUALITY AND PURITY
ASSIGNED TO ALL FRESH SURFACE WATERS WITHIN EIGHTEENMILE CREEK DRAINAGE BASIN
AND OTHER TRIBUTARIES OF LAKE ONTARIO BETWEEN NIAGARA RIVER AND EIGHTEENMILE
CREEK

No. Waters Index

Number

Name

Description

Map

Ref. No. Class

Standards

Ont. 148 portion as described

Eighteenmile Creek

Enters Lake Ontario at Olcott 0.2 mile north of
N.Y. Route 18 (Lake Road). Mouth to trib. a which enters from southeast in
southern part of Olcott and north of Lakeview Cemetery. G-5sw

Ont. 148-4 and 1, 2 (Eighteenmile Creek) and trib., 2a and tribs., 3, 4, 5, 6 and trib., 7 including P 183a, P 184a, P 186, P 187, P 189a

Eighteenmile Creek The Gulf, and all subtribs. This segment of Eighteenmile Creek flows in
northwesterly direction draining Lockport area. The stream joins an unnamed
trib. at point 0.2 mile west of Purdy Road 0.7 mile southwesterly of
intersection of Purdy Road and Ridge Road (U.S. Route 104). Trib. which drains
western part of Lockport, flows northwesterly through a ravine known as The

Gulf. P 183a is a quarry pond within northern part of Lockport, 0.6 mile
southeast of intersection of Purdy Road and Old Niagara Road. P 184a is located
along Barge Canal 0.5 mile southwest of canal bridge on Old Niagara Road in
northeast part of Lockport. P 186 and P 187 are impoundments on Eighteenmile

Creek 0.4 and 0.2 mile respectively north of Barge Canal. P 189a is located 0.4
mile southeast of intersection of N.Y. Routes 93 and 31 in western section of

Lockport. H-5nw H-4ne
D
D
16

tribs., 7

Enter trib. of Eighteenmile Creek in section
between point 0.1 mile southwest of junction of Stone Road and Johnson Road to
point 0.3 mile south of intersection of Plank Road and Lower Mountain

Road. H-5nw H-4ne
D
D

P 190a, P 190b, P 190c, P 190d, P 190e, P 190f

Myers Pond, Bonds Lake and unnamed ponds

Group of isolated ponds outside northeast corner of

and Dickerson Road are as follows: P 190a-0.3 mile, P 190b-0.8 mile, P 190c-0.1
mile, P 190d-1.0 mile, P 190e-1.1 miles, P 190f-1.3 miles. H-4nw

Subtribs. of Fourmile Creek

Trib. 2 enters from east immediately south of
east-west service road joining Lutts Road and 0.2 mile northeast of

within an industrial area. Trib. 3 enters from east immediately south of Balmer

Road culvert. H-4nw

Ont. 157 and tribs. including P 191b, Ont. 157a

Tribs. of Lake Ontario

Ont. 157 enters 1.5 miles east of Fort Niagara

Beach and 0.5 mile northwest of intersection of Lake Road and Creek Road. Ont. 157a is located in Fort Niagara State Park area and has no direct outlet to

Lake Ontario. G-3se
C
C
48

Barge Canal portion as described including P 185
and P 184a

Barge Canal

This section of canal within topographical limits
of Eighteenmile Creek drainage basin from canal bridge E-219 at Wruck Road and
0.5 mile northeast of Reynales Basin to topographical limit line which passes
through intersection of Hinman Road and Bear Ridge Road (formerly State Road)
in southwest portion of Lockport. P 185 (Wide Waters) is located immediately
upstream and southwesterly from canal bridge E-226 on Old Niagara Road. P 184a
is located 0.1 mile downstream from bridge E-227 carrying a spur of New York

Central Railroad. H-5ne H-5nw
C
C

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
